reviews.review_msg: Benita is a great prof. This course had a lot of important lecture content and I learned a lot. If you're racist, bigoted or rooted in your white/cis/male privilege you probably won't like her, but you'll sure learn something about the world. She challenges you to work harder and think deeper. Not as easy as I would expect for a 100-level course.

Benita is an amazing professor!! She is clear on instructions and is a fair marker. She is such an inspirational professor. She really does care about the students in her class and tries to make their experience a very meaningful one. Although sometimes there may be a bit of reading, it is definitely worth the knowledge.
Benita's lecture content was useful and she was committed to the subject more than other instructors. She takes a social justice approach when teaching about society which I liked.

Benita is great. very important and informative lectures. I learned a lot from her and she became an inspirational figure for me. she asks for a good share of work but it al makes you more engaged in the subjects. recommend this course! Benita goes extra miles to help and engage students. She loves to spend time with her students and truly helps!

Benita's class is not easy, but she will challenge you to work harder and think differently.  You may not always agree with her ideas, but it is worth it to keep an open mind;  this is one class that really made me think, and one that I really learned and grew from. Take her class if you actually care about learning, and not just about the grade.

Way too hard for a 100 level course. Strong bias on her perspectives and opinions, long lectures with no powerpoint provided so make sure you don't skip and take notes. Basically anything from the whole textbook can be tested. Lots of theories that must be applied to almost everything.

Benita is one of the best of not the best prof I've had in the four years of my undergrad. She challenges you and supports you (don't expects you to do the work and won't spoon feed you). I have the utmost respect for her and am extremely grateful to have taken this class

Benita is by far the worst prof I've had so far in 3 years. Turned a seemingly interesting intro course into a horribly boring and extremely difficult class. Very close minded. Deliberately limited informationhelp that she offered and allowed TA's to offer. Made a ridiculous criteria for assignments and tests. The list goes on and on... Avoid!!!
